title: Boot Enchantments
body: Awhile ago you guys removed boot enchantments because Alacrity was crowding out choices and If I recalled correctly you said you'd work on new boot enchantments and re release them? So what's going on with that?

Throwing some mastery emotes or the taunt emote is also a good way to get that ball rolling.

It is ofc. a chance to take, to be the first one to do it. And it's dependant on non-tryharders, because if you do it first, and you get a "wtf dude!?" from a teammate, you know you're in the wrong company.
_If someone NEED to flash away within the 5 minutes after the minions spawn, they've spectacularly failed their positioning._

Riot has probably been thinking about this a lot. It's definitely something that they "might" do, but it's a big step and they don't want to do something that they regret afterwards because things don't always go as they plan (*cough* dynamic queue).

I think that a big reason to keep boots would be that you have a choice. A decision to make. Against skillshot champions, you may want to get boots earlier to dodge their attacks. If you're an all in champ fighting another all in champ who both have massive slows, then boots are not as important and can be bought later on.

I believe Boots should be removed entirely. Base move speed should go up each level:
+3 @lvl 2
+3 @lvl 3
+4 @lvl 4
+4 @lvl 5
+5 @lvl 6
+6 @lvl 7

Which would bring it to standard Boots +25 

Then add the upgraded boot stats into some of the core items for each target buyer and make so that they can only purchase one of those items.

IE: merge {{item:3031}} and {{item:3006}} so that IE gets the bonus 35% atk spd and +20 move speed as well as its other stats. Probably would change the recipe to include some sort of talisman or something. 

Extra item could be:  Berserker's Talisman  +10% atk spd and +10 Move speed @400 gold
- which would then combine with {{item:1051}}  @400 gold to be a new cloak (Berserker's Cloak which would replace the Cloak of Agility in the IE recipe)  @ 1000 gold (combine cost of 200 gold) which would have +20% Crit, +20% Atk Spd and +15 move speed. IE overall cost would go up to 3800 from 3600 but you save money in the long run cuz you no longer buy berzerker greaves. And then you throw "Limited to 1" on the IE as well.

Just an example of how it might look. I hope they do something like this in Pre-Season 7
Wouldn't that snowball the game even harder? If you're low level you can't even kite enemies.
If Riot removes {{item:3009}} I will lose my mind http://i.imgur.com/WBwTMh5.png

They've been nerfed to the ground anyway, 10 more movespeed makes little to no difference and the slow resistance is only good if the enemy team has zero hard CC.  Even if they don't you're probably better buying boots with actual stats tbh.

Still had great uses for these boots.

Though to be honest i find the existence of {{item:3117}} and {{item:3009}} together just completely useless.

Just get rid of one of them. If your a support main you can just take the boots of mobility (yellow) to do a fast gank or catch up with your team quickly and supports tend to be in specific positions casting spells (support or damage) from far range most likely a 5 second walk for the enemy to even get slightly close to you.

As for tanks you can just rush in and if you have a frozen heart, randuins, sunfire, you can keep on ccing the enemy etc.
I do take mobility boots depending on the situation if support or jungler.

But if im top i always take merc treads or boots of swiftness so i can still move fast (not as mobility boots) and not get slowed if in combat.

Mobi's only work out of combat.
Swifties work in combat.

So, they are both extremely different despite the same effect.

There is really no point in building it over mercs.
{{item:3009}}  10 movement speed, 25% Slow resistance.
{{item:3111}}  25 MR, 30% Tenacity.

Not only do you get a bit of MR from mercs but also it gives a stronger passive.

If your worried about being kited to death by slows then swiftes are still the go to. CC means merc treads are better. However I do prefer merc trends since move speed difference isn't much and it also has gives some early MR.

They said they may still do something with boot enchants, but the pre-season would be the most likely time for it. Especially now with Worlds right around the corner they're not going to make large changes to the game.
